items.title: Alpha Alternatives invests Rs 1,250 crore in ASF Insignia
items.summary: Alpha Alternatives is investing Rs 1,250 crore in ASF Insignia, a large IT office campus in Gurugram. The funds will be used to reduce debt and support future development. This investment aims to make the campus ready for a REIT listing. The project is designed to attract tenants with competitive rental rates.

items.title: Suzlon Energy shares can gain nearly 50%, says Systematix after initiating with Buy. 4 reasons why
items.summary: Systematix has initiated coverage on Suzlon Energy with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 67, implying nearly 50% upside. Analysts cite Suzlon’s market leadership, stronger financials, expanding order book, and improving margins as key drivers. Robust execution and supportive industry tailwinds are expected to sustain growth through FY26–FY28.

items.title: Shayona Engineering IPO booked 59% so far on Day 1: Check key dates, price band, GMP and other details
items.summary: Shayona Engineering IPO allotment status is expected to be finalised on January 28, with the listing of Shayona Engineering shares on BSE SME likely on January 30.

items.title: Air India braces for record $1.6 billion loss after deadly crash in Ahmedabad last year
items.summary: The losses come on the back of a turbulent year for Indian aviation marked by flier anxiety, flight delays and mass cancellations by a rival carrier that has put a spotlight on the duopolistic market structure

items.title: Markets trim early gains but hold positive territory on global relief rally
items.summary: Dr Reddy’s Laboratories led the Nifty gainers with a 5.46% jump to ₹1,220.40, followed by Bharat Electronics, which climbed 3.02% to ₹414.80

items.title: Reliance to buy sanctions-compliant Russian oil in February and March, sources say
items.summary: Reliance last received Russian crude in December after securing a one-month U.S. concession that allowed it to winddown dealings with the sanctioned Russian oil producer Rosneft beyond a November ​21 deadline

items.title: Netflix shares fall despite Q4 beat as Warner Bros bidding war weighs on stock
items.summary: Investor sentiment remained weak due to uncertainty around the Warner Bros. Discovery deal. Netflix also told investors it would pause share buybacks to conserve cash for the proposed acquisition. The ongoing bidding war and funding concerns weighed on the stock, which had already slipped over 5 per cent in premarket trade.

items.title: Small-cap IT stock jumps 6% following stock market rebound. Do you own?
items.summary: Blue Cloud Softech Solutions share price has fallen 28% in one month and has declined 44% in the past six months. The smallcap stock has plunged 58% in one year, while it has delivered multibagger returns of 262% in the past five years.

items.title: ‘EU ready to deliver on powerful agenda with India’: EU Foreign Policy Chief Kaja Kallas
items.summary: The European Union and India will hold the 16th summit in New Delhi, where a new EU-India comprehensive strategic agenda is expected to be adopted

items.title: India-EU FTA to unlock global markets and tech sharing, says Bharti Enterprises Vice-Chairman Rajan Bharti Mittal
items.summary: Davos: India and the European Union are close to signing a Free Trade Agreement. Industry leaders and diplomats expressed optimism at the World Economic Forum in Davos. The deal is expected to boost technology sharing and exports. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's upcoming visit to India is anticipated to be the occasion for the signing.

items.title: Sam Altman in UAE as OpenAI turns to Middle East for estimated $50 billion funding round
items.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is in the Middle East seeking to raise at least $50 billion in funding, with valuations between $750 billion and $830 billion. Early talks include major investors, and discussions with Amazon about a $10 billion investment have also occurred.

items.title: China’s bumper silver exports belie market fears of curbs
items.summary: China transitioned to license-only management from a quota system seven years ago, leading to silver exports rising in all but one year, primarily due to increased non-ferrous refining capacity where silver is a by-product

items.title: Billionaire Deepinder Goyal to sacrifice Rs 1,000 crore Eternal ESOPs on giving up CEO role
items.summary: Deepinder Goyal is giving up more than ₹1,000 crore worth of unvested ESOPs as he steps down as Group CEO of Eternal, returning 3.3 crore shares to the company’s pool. Seen as a rare corporate governance move, the decision could reduce the need for near-term shareholder dilution.

items.title: ET Budget 2026 Survey: No easy choices for India this year as policy space shrinks dramatically in tariffs' wake
items.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations Survey: With February 1 on the horizon, India finds itself grappling with uncertain global trade dynamics and various domestic challenges. ET's pre-budget survey indicates that citizens are overwhelmingly in favour of promoting local manufacturing and increasing exports. Additionally, many are advocating for income tax cuts.

items.title: Nissan Gravite Launch Date Postponed: Japanese carmaker provides an update about the new MPV
items.summary: Nissan has postponed the launch of its new seven-seater MPV, the Gravite, in India. The company has not yet announced a new launch date. The Gravite is expected to be a crucial model for Nissan's expansion in the Indian market.  Details about the revised launch will be shared soon.  This MPV is anticipated to be competitively priced.

items.title: ET@DAVOS: How Geopolitics, Agentic AI, and Gen Z talent are rewriting the growth playbook
Trump–Greenland tensions ease as markets bet on post-Davos deal: Ajay Bagga
items.summary: Global markets are factoring in a negotiated settlement on Greenland after the Davos summit, limiting fears of a prolonged impact on bonds and currencies. Market expert  says investors expect diplomacy to prevail despite renewed geopolitical noise.

items.title: Rupee stability key market trigger as earnings hold up: Rahul Singh
items.summary: Indian equities are seeking a decisive trigger amidst noisy global cues and improving domestic fundamentals. While earnings season has met expectations, macro concerns, particularly currency stability, are weighing on investor confidence. Valuations are normalizing, with excesses now stock-specific, and markets remain in a wait-and-watch mode.

items.title: Stocks to buy: Nagaraj Shetti recommends SAIL, Fortis Healthcare shares to buy
items.summary: Stock market surged on January 22, with Sensex gaining over 850 points and Nifty 50 rising above 1%. Positive global indicators and reduced trade tensions boosted investor confidence, while domestic institutional investors purchased shares worth  ₹4,181.74 crore.

items.title: Air India braces for record Rs 150,00 crore loss after deadly crash
items.summary: Air India is set to report a record annual loss of at least ₹15,000 crore for the year ending March 31 after a deadly crash and airspace disruptions reversed its turnaround efforts. The airline, jointly owned by Tata Group and Singapore Airlines, was moving toward break-even before the June Dreamliner crash that killed over 240 people.

items.title: Union Budget FY27: Defence budget set to soar, Jefferies says betting on HAL, BEL and Data Patterns
items.summary: Jefferies expects India’s defence budget to rise sharply in FY27, extending the indigenisation push. With strong capex momentum, rising exports and record order inflows, HAL, BEL and Data Patterns emerge as the brokerage’s top sectoral picks.

items.title: Net FDI negative for fourth month in a row in November 2025, outflows exceed inflows by $446 million
items.summary: Net foreign portfolio investments have also been negative so far in the financial year 2025-26, with uncertainty over the India-U.S. trade deal and the weakening rupee affecting investor confidence

items.title: Armour Security shares hit 5% lower circuit after listing at a sharp discount; SME stock down 24% from issue price
items.summary: Armour Security shares were listed at  ₹45.60 apiece on NSE SME, a discount of 20% to the issue price of  ₹57 per share. The SME stock succumbed to selling pressure and hit a 5% lower circuit of  ₹43.35 apiece.

items.title: Change but no change? What Deepinder Goyal’s resignation means for Eternal shareholders
items.summary: Eternal's founder Deepinder Goyal is stepping down as Group CEO after 18 years. Albinder Dhindsa, Blinkit chief, will take the helm. Goyal will focus on long-term strategy, culture, and ethics. Dhindsa will manage day-to-day operations and continue leading Blinkit. This transition aims to drive Eternal's growth and societal impact.

items.title: Eternal’s post-founder test begins as Deepinder Goyal steps back, analysts turn cautious
items.summary: The transition makes Eternal's Deepinder Goyal only the second founder and CEO of an internet startup that went public to relinquish his role from overseeing daily business operations. Freshworks founder Girish Mathrubootham stepped aside as CEO in May 2024 to become chairman

items.title: Trump policies put dollar dominance under fresh global scrutiny
items.summary: Morgan Stanley warns that Donald Trump’s stance on trade, debt, sanctions and institutions could influence the pace of global de-dollarisation. While the dollar’s dominance has been slowly eroding, no clear reserve currency alternative has emerged. Gold has strengthened as the primary challenger amid rising geopolitical and fiscal uncertainties.

items.title: AI accessibility: Use India’s AI Summit to define it clearly and set a mandate for the world to adopt
items.summary: We need a definition that aligns AI development with India’s legal and disability jurisprudence, so that “AI for all” does not remain a summit slogan. For inclusion, we must not just ensure barrier-free access to AI at inception, but set its self-learning ability the task of accommodating everyone.

items.title: RBI taps $2 billion-plus FX swaps to blunt liquidity hit from spot intervention, bankers say
items.summary: The RBI’s swap lowered ⁠dollar/rupee hedging costs, countering the upward pressure on forward premiums that would normally accompany a fall in the currency

items.title: India's installed power capacity rises 36% in 5 years; 2025 sees record renewable additions: RBI
items.summary: This sharp rise was primarily led by a surge in solar power installations, reflecting strong policy support and growing private sector participation in the renewable energy space

items.title: Ipsos to invest $1.4 billion over five years on AI, acquisitions
items.summary: The investment plan will be split between acquisitions, targeting specific technologies, and improving its internal capabilities, CEO Jean-Laurent Poitou said.

items.summary: Considerations are preliminary and Sun Pharma may decide to not pursue a bid

items.summary: Experts seek support for natural practices; rebalancing of farm subsidies to transform rural livelihoods

items.summary: Solid fundamentals don’t come close to explaining silver’s meteoric rise. Why it may not last.

items.title: Home sales surge 15% in Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Chennai: PropTiger
items.summary: Housing sales in Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Chennai surged by 15 percent last year, reaching over 1.33 lakh units. This growth was fueled by improved supply and robust demand. While overall sales across eight major cities declined, these three southern hubs demonstrated strong performance. Developers managed supply effectively, keeping prices stable.

items.title: From Tariffs to Turbulence: Trump’s moves test market nerves again
items.summary: Global markets are on edge again as President Trump’s renewed tariff threats and geopolitical tensions revive the “Sell America” narrative. A broad risk-off move hit equities, Treasuries and the dollar, unsettling investors who now fear this volatility could prove more persistent as uncertainty over U.S.–Europe trade and Greenland tensions lingers.

items.title: Defence, infrastructure emerge top sectoral bets ahead of Budget: smallcase
items.summary: smallcase managers stay bullish on medium-term equities despite near-term volatility

items.title: Thangamayil Jewellery Q2 net profit more than doubles
items.summary: Gold ornament volume sales went up 32 per cent, while silver product sales rose 41 per cent. For diamonds, sales value jumped 46 per cent

items.title: India’s inequality problem won’t be solved by freebies—it needs long-term solutions
items.summary: Cash transfers offer governments a quick, visible response to rising inequality, but they risk masking deeper distortions. As fiscal pressures mount, essential services suffer. To address wide gaps between haves and have-nots, India must intervene more decisively in its capital and labour markets

items.title: Silver prices tumble Rs 18,000/kg in 2 days on MCX. Will white metal give up the Rs 3 lakh mark?
items.summary: Silver prices on MCX have seen a significant drop, shedding Rs 18,000 in two sessions due to easing geopolitical concerns and optimism around a US-India trade deal. Experts suggest buying on dips, with strong support levels identified. Despite volatility, silver remains a compelling long-term hedge against inflation and market uncertainty.

items.title: Credit flow to commercial sector jumps 15% to Rs 298 lakh crore: RBI data
items.summary: Financial resources for businesses saw a significant 15% increase, reaching Rs 298 lakh crore by December. This growth was fueled by both banks and non-bank lenders. Non-bank credit now forms a substantial 47% of these total flows. NBFCs are expanding lending faster than banks. Corporate bond issuance also contributed to this positive trend.

items.title: Anshul Saigal sees bottom-up opportunities in Indian market
items.summary: Indian stocks show promise as valuations cool and earnings improve. Anshul Saigal of Saigal Capital sees selective opportunities for long-term investors. Macro headwinds are easing, making India attractive. PSU banks and the CDMO pharma space offer strong prospects. Metals also present an attractive outlook. Investors should focus on companies with strong cash flow and growth visibility.

items.title: The BITSoM MBA – for Impactful Leadership Careers

items.title: Silver ETFs crash up to 24% as MCX silver rate eases 4% — What explains this divergence?
items.summary: Even as silver futures eased 4%, the fall in silver ETFs was much starker. Tata Silver ETF on MCX crashed almost 24% to  ₹25.56 today. Edelweiss Silver ETF and Mirae Asset plunged 22% each. 360 ONE Silver ETF lost 21%, and Nippon India Silver ETF shed 20% on NSE.

items.title: Silver prices to hit $200 in 2026? Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki makes bold prediction
items.summary: Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki predicts silver could reach $200 per ounce by 2026, citing its historical use as money and its crucial role as a "structural metal" in modern technology. He highlighted silver's significant price appreciation since 1990, reinforcing his long-term bullish stance despite recent market retreats.

items.title: CreditAccess shares rally 20% in two days after Q3FY26 profit turnaround
items.summary: CreditAccess Grameen shares surged sharply after the lender returned to profitability in Q3FY26. Lower provisions supported earnings, while improving asset quality and strong technical indicators boosted investor confidence, despite the stock trading at premium valuation levels.

items.title: Budget 2026: Four infra stocks showing technical promise amid capex hopes
items.summary: As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, the infrastructure sector is buzzing. Market expert Ankush Bajaj shares his recommendations.

items.title: Zee Entertainment shares jump 4% ahead of Q3 results, look set to snap 4-day losing streak
items.summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises share price jumped as much as 4% in intraday trade on the BSE on Thursday, January 22, ahead of the company's December quarter earnings.

items.title: Markets jump 1% on easing global trade tensions; PSU Banks, Auto stocks shine
items.summary: 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 774.04 points, or 0.94%, to 82,683.67 in early trade; 50-share NSE Nifty rose 233.85 points, or 0.93%, to 25,391.35

items.title: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centres boost chip demand
items.summary: Intel shareholders are optimistic about the company’s results like they have not been for many quarters

items.title: Dhun Wellness raises $4 million for expansion
items.summary: Dhun Wellness, a luxury urban wellness venture by Mira Kapoor, has secured $4 million in funding to build India's first integrated luxury urban wellness ecosystem. The investment will fuel expansion into cities like Delhi, Pune, Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Ahmedabad, while also developing a comprehensive longevity vertical.

items.title: India bonds advance on RBI buying buzz, firm US debt
items.summary: On Thursday morning, a notable rally in Indian government bonds caught the attention of investors, largely due to speculation that the Reserve Bank of India was maneuvering in the secondary market. Coupled with a strong performance from U.S. Treasury yields, this provided an additional boost.

items.title: Share India declares board meeting date to announce Q3 results 2026, third interim dividend
items.summary: Share India's board will meet on January 27, 2026, to approve Q3 results and discuss a third interim dividend for FY 2025-2026. The company reported slight growth in Q2 FY26 but a decrease compared to last year amid challenging market conditions.

items.title: After capacity creation, manufacturing looks to Budget 2026 for the next push
items.summary: Union Budget: India’s manufacturing sector has moved from policy intent to capacity creation, with investment gaining pace across industries. As the Union Budget nears, stakeholders are looking for system-level reforms that improve competitiveness, remove bottlenecks and support innovation and scale in the next phase of growth.

items.title: Q3 Results Live: IndiGo profit slumps 78% YoY to Rs 550 crore; check other key companies to announce earnings today
Balaji Wafers inks pact for strategic investment from General Atlantic
items.summary: Gujarat's Balaji Wafers is set to receive a significant investment from global investor General Atlantic. This partnership aims to boost corporate functions and drive product innovation. The company plans to expand its reach across India. Balaji Wafers is a leading player in the salty snack market. The deal is expected to close in 2026.

items.title: Snack food player Balaji wafers bags investment from General Atlantic
items.summary: The financial terms of the transaction was not disclosed

items.title: General Atlantic invests in Gujarat-based Balaji Wafers for undisclosed sum
items.summary: There is significant growth potential in India’s packaged snacks market as households increasingly seek affordable, convenient and high-quality food products, General Atlantic said post the investment in Balaji.

items.title: Indian economy has transformed from ‘emerging’ to 'pivotal,' ministers at Davos declare
items.summary: India is now a pivotal global economic force, moving beyond its emerging status. This transformation is driven by strong growth and widespread digital public infrastructure. Platforms like digital identity and real-time payments have lowered costs and fostered innovation. India's evolution highlights momentum in physical and digital infrastructure. Domestic consumption and capabilities are key opportunities.

items.title: Over 70 recyclers register under ₹1,500-cr critical mineral recycling scheme: JNARDDC
items.summary: “India must act now to build domestic recycling and recovery capacity if it wants secure supply chains,” Agnihotri said

items.title: ICICI Prudential Smallcap Fund reopens after 22-month hiatus
items.summary: The fund had stopped accepting fresh subscriptions on March 14, 2024, following concerns over elevated valuations in mid-cap and small-cap stocks

items.title: Budget 2026 could drive a power shift in India’s semiconductor push
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: The nation aims to become a top chip manufacturing hub by 2032. Several major projects are underway, with production expected to start in 2026. The budget must ensure sustained policy support and timely incentive disbursements to maintain momentum and attract further investment in this crucial sector.

items.title: KPMG Global Services opens new tax office in Kolkata
items.summary: From Kolkata, KGSDP's tax team supports areas such as tax compliance and reporting, global mobility services, expatriate taxation, indirect tax and transfer pricing, and is hiring across multiple experience levels

items.title: Fed likely to stay put through May despite rising calls for cuts
items.summary: A majority of economists now expect the US Federal Reserve to keep interest rates unchanged through the current quarter, and possibly until Chair Jerome Powell’s term ends in May, marking a shift from earlier expectations of a near-term rate cut.

items.title: Deepinder Goyal resigns as Zomato CEO — Check his net worth, salary, education, family
items.summary: Deepinder Goyal said in a letter to shareholders on Wednesday that he was shifting focus to his other ventures involving “exploration and experimentation beyond the company's core businesses.”

items.title: Eternal earnings: Leadership shock may weigh on stock despite margin improvement, says Dharmesh Kant
items.summary: Cholamandalam Securities’ Dharmesh Kant says Eternal’s stock may open lower after an unexpected leadership move, despite sequential margin improvement. PAT missed estimates, quick commerce cash burn remains high, and Blinkit’s EBITDA breakeven may be premature. He sees short-term trading opportunity, but stays cautious on long-term valuations amid intense competition from Amazon, Flipkart, and Swiggy in India markets.

items.title: No Budget 2026 buzz as railway stocks slump up to 44% from last annual financial statement. What should investors do?
items.summary: Railway stocks have failed to generate Budget excitement this year, with many down sharply since Budget 2025. Valuation concerns, slow execution and muted capex expectations have weighed on sentiment, prompting investors to await fresh growth triggers.

items.title: Waaree Energies shares soars 12% after strong Q3 FY26 earnings
items.summary: Waaree Energies' shares surged 12% to Rs 2713 after reporting over 100% year-on-year growth in Q3 FY26 revenue and profit. The company announced a record order book of Rs 60,000 crore and achieved significant solar module and cell production milestones, bolstering confidence in future performance.

items.title: Shadowfax Tech IPO subscribed 60% on day 2
items.summary: The three-day IPO received bids for 5,33,05,920 shares against 8,90,88,807 shares on offer

items.title: Digital Real Estate | Union Budget 2026: Knight Frank calls for strong push to revive affordable and rental housing
items.summary: As India readies Union Budget 2026, Knight Frank urges decisive fiscal support to revive affordable and rental housing. With sub-Rs 50 lakh sales plunging and affordability eroding, the consultancy recommends higher PMAY limits, increased interest deductions, rental income tax waivers, and green-building incentives to restore demand and strengthen the housing ecosystem.

items.title: Crude oil futures gain as Trump backs away from European tariff threat over Greenland
items.summary: Oil Market Report says that the world oil supply is now projected to rise by 2.5 million barrels a day this year to 108.7 million barrels a day, following an increase of 3 million barrels a day in 2025

items.title: Ray Dalio bullish on gold despite silver price rally outshining gold rates
items.summary: Historically, Ray Dalio said that during times of conflicts and international geopolitical conflicts, even allies do not want to hold each other's debt and prefer hard currency — a pattern that has been repeated over centuries.

items.title: Rupee recovers 15 paise from all-time low to 91.50 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: Forex traders said investors' sentiments improved after President Trump announced in Davos on January 21, 2026 that he was scrapping his planned tariffs on eight European nations in an effort to force U.S. control over Greenland

items.title: Rs 9,000 crore wipeout! Ola shares tumble nearly 40% in 3 months. Time to buy or wait?
items.summary: Ola Electric shares have plummeted nearly 40% in three months, wiping out Rs 9,000 crore in market value and nearing all-time lows. This sharp decline is attributed to a broader downtrend, senior management resignations, and significant stake trimming by major investors like SoftBank, despite recent market share gains.

items.title: India-EU FTA critical for export growth, supply-chain resilience, and long-term investment: Industry leaders
items.summary: Indian industry leaders, policymakers and diplomats have called for an early conclusion of the India–EU free trade agreement, arguing it is vital for boosting exports, strengthening supply chains and attracting long-term investment amid rising global uncertainty. The push gained momentum at a high-level dialogue in New Delhi, following renewed political signals around the FTA after discussions at Davos.

items.title: Angel One shares gain 3%, snap 3 day fall. What should investors do?
items.summary: Angel One shares rebounded after a three day decline as investors bought at lower levels. Despite a year on year profit dip, sequential revenue growth, margin expansion, dividend announcement and positive brokerage commentary support near term sentiment, though volatility may persist.

items.title: Markets surge over 1% as Trump eases tariff stance, short-covering lifts indices
items.summary: The Sensex opened at ₹82,459.66, up from ₹81,909.63, and was trading at ₹82,742.16, gaining 832.53 points (1.02%) at 9:50 a.m; The Nifty opened at ₹25,344.15, up from ₹25,157.50, and rose to ₹25,424.70, up 267.20 points (1.06%)

items.title: NITI Aayog suggests setting up of national agency to implement green transition for MSMEs
items.summary: MSMEs rely heavily on fossil fuels to meet their energy and process requirements, resulting in approximately 135 million tonnes of carbon emissions (MtCO2e) in 2022 alone

items.title: Metals outlook brightens on global cues; Trent faces near-term headwinds: Siddhartha Khemka
items.summary: Indian metal stocks are poised for a favorable phase, driven by robust global demand for both precious and industrial metals, alongside supply constraints and supportive Indian policies. Copper, zinc, and aluminum are expected to see upside, with ferrous metals to follow, as China's demand and domestic protectionism bolster the sector.

items.title: Rupee recovers 15 paise from all-time low to 91.50 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: The Indian Rupee has recovered from its lowest point against the US Dollar. This rebound follows positive sentiment after President Trump indicated no new tariffs on Europe. Domestic stock markets also saw gains, supporting the Rupee's recovery. However, global uncertainties and trade deal progress remain key factors influencing the currency's future stability.

items.title: MyHome Group expands beyond Hyderabad, enters Mumbai, Bengaluru and Chennai with Rs 4,100 crore committed capital
items.summary: South India's MyHome Group is making a significant nationwide push, investing ₹4,100 crore to expand into Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Chennai. This strategic move aims to leverage their proven success in Hyderabad, with new projects promising a development potential of 46.6 million sq. ft. and a GDV of ₹37,500 crore, marking a new growth phase for the 4-decade-old conglomerate.

items.title: Tata group keen to invest in Telangana in various sectors, to associate in Musi Riverfront project
items.summary: Discussions further covered the proposed Young India Sports University and the State’s plans to upgrade public sports infrastructure with the aim of helping India win medals at the 2036 Olympics

items.title: Stocks to buy or sell: Osho Krishan of Angel One suggests buying Hindustan Copper, Ramco Cements shares on 22 January
items.summary: Indian stock market opened positively as investor sentiment improved after Trump retracted tariff threats against Europe. Analysts suggest caution as volatility persists, with support around 24,900 and recommended buys include Hindustan Copper and Ramco Cements.

items.title: Prologis beats quarterly revenue estimates as warehouse demand holds firm
items.summary: Prologis, a major real estate firm, exceeded revenue expectations in the fourth quarter. Strong demand for its storage facilities, used by retailers and manufacturers for e-commerce and inventory, boosted performance. The company, which manages vast logistics real estate globally, also expanded its data center power pipeline. Prologis expressed confidence in future earnings growth.

items.title: Manufacturers beef up legal teams amid evolving rules
items.summary: Manufacturing companies are strengthening their in-house legal leadership as business activity accelerates and regulatory complexity rises. Demand for senior legal talent is being driven by tighter scrutiny, new labour codes, ESG and data rules, and a surge in cross-border deals, capacity expansion and compliance-heavy projects.

items.title: Anand Mahindra calls Blackstone CEO's India praise ‘massive news, even by Davos standards’ — Here's why
items.summary: Blackstone CEO Steve Schwarzman had earlier hailed India as the company's number one business. Anand Mahindra called his a great validation of India's trajectory.

items.title: Labdhi Lifestyle to invest Rs 700 cr to build office complex at BKC, Mumbai
items.summary: Labdhi Lifestyle Ltd is investing Rs 700 crore to develop 'BKC Edge', a 2.25 lakh sq ft premium office complex in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex. The project, expected to generate over Rs 1,000 crore in sales, aims to address the acute supply constraints for Grade-A office spaces in the area. The development will feature more than 300 business suites.

items.title: Walmart, Microsoft, Tiger Global to sell 50.7 million shares in PhonePe's IPO
items.summary: PhonePe ​received regulatory approval ⁠for its stock market listing after confidentially filing for ​an IPO ⁠in September

items.title: JSW Steel Q3 preview: Import curbs lift stock, but earnings seen under pressure
items.summary: JSW Steel shares rose 5.7% since 30 December, outperforming the benchmark Sensex. But this may have come a quarter too late, as the domestic market leader saw the prices of its product fall to an absolute low during the October-December quarter

items.title: VinFast eyes expansion in tier-3 and tier-4 markets
items.summary: Ghosh said the company, besides getting new customers for its EVs as part of the strategy, would attract ICE engine-powered vehicle owners for switching to EVs through special campaigns

items.title: Norway sovereign wealth fund shuts Paris real estate investment office
items.summary: Norway's sovereign wealth fund is consolidating its European real estate team in London, closing its Paris office opened in 2018. This move aims to enhance effectiveness in delivering returns, though the fund's real estate exposure in France remains unchanged. The Paris office employed six people.

items.title: SBI Chief highlights bank's focus on emerging technologies like AI and cybersecurity at the WEF 2026 in Davos
items.summary: State Bank of India Chairman Challa Sreenivasulu Setty is attending the World Economic Forum in Davos. He is discussing the bank's focus on artificial intelligence and cybersecurity. India's economic and technological growth is a key highlight at the forum. Union Ministers are also presenting India's progress in renewable energy and semiconductors. India is set to become the world's third-largest economy.

items.title: This Budget India must re-incentivise global capital or risk being ignored
items.summary: India can no longer assume foreign capital will return on narrative alone. In USD terms, Indian equities have delivered lower returns, deeper drawdowns and weaker risk-adjusted performance than major U.S. indices. Without reducing friction, improving stability and boosting investor confidence, India risks not outflows—but global capital indifference.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 snap 3-day losing streak; investors earn  ₹5 lakh crore— What drove the Indian stock market higher?
items.summary: The Sensex rose 398 points, or 0.49%, to close at 82,307, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,290, rising 132 points. A sharp rally in the equities market made investors richer by  ₹5 lakh crore in a session.

items.title: Sudip Bandyopadhyay on why profits, not just growth, will decide winners in consumer and platform stocks
items.summary: Earnings season is here. Investors are watching new-age consumer and platform businesses closely. Eternal reported strong growth. Swiggy's results are due soon. Profitability is the key focus for food delivery and quick commerce. IndiaMART outlook is neutral. ITC Hotels looks attractive after a price drop. Operational discipline and sector tailwinds will attract investors.

items.title: Viewers chose theatres more to watch Hindi films in 2025
items.summary: Hindi films drew more audiences to cinemas in 2025. Ticket sales for Hindi movies increased, bucking a general decline in all film footfalls. This growth highlights the importance of content. Producers believe good films will continue to attract viewers to theaters. The industry sees a co-existence of theatrical and home entertainment experiences. Word-of-mouth remains a key driver for successful films.

items.title: Goldman Sachs raises 2026-end gold price forecast by $500 to $5,400/oz

While goods exports slowed and the rupee weakened amid global churn and US tariff pressures, service exports, softer crude prices, easing food inflation and policy support helped the domestic economy stay resilient.

items.title: Why India’s coal revival looks impossible to achieve
items.summary: India coal sector: Coal power is declining globally. China's coal use is falling. India faces challenges in building new coal plants. Renewables are set to meet India's future energy needs. This shift marks a significant change in global energy trends, with the world moving towards cleaner energy sources.

items.summary: India is poised to become the world's largest economy within two to three decades. This projection comes from David Rubenstein, cofounder of Carlyle Group. He also noted positive US-India relations and discussed US-China trade dynamics. Rubenstein advised Indian policymakers to embrace global private credit and equity investments to foster local entrepreneurship and retain talent within India.

items.summary: UK-based Actis is reportedly looking to exit its Indian renewable energy platform, Athena Renewable Energy, for an enterprise value of around ₹3,000 crore. The firm has appointed Kotak Mahindra Capital as its financial advisor and has approached several potential buyers for the 550 MW solar platform. This move follows Actis's history of successful exits in India's growing clean energy sector.

items.title: Davos: Swiss firms’ interest in India surges after EFTA trade deal
items.summary: A wave of Swiss business enthusiasm is sweeping towards India, following the recent Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement with the European Free Trade Association. The number of investment inquiries and advisory support requests has skyrocketed, more than doubling in frequency.

items.title: Over 160 drug samples found sub-standard in December
items.summary: A recent inspection by India's drug regulator has revealed a troubling statistic: 167 medication samples were classified as not of standard quality (NSQ) in December, with valuable insights from both central and state laboratories aiding the findings. Many of these samples consisted of widely used drugs, highlighting a critical need for heightened quality control.

items.title: TV ad volumes dip in 2025 as streaming services gain, RMG ban takes effect
items.summary: TV ad spending dropped in 2025. A ban on real money gaming and budget cuts by major sectors caused this decline. Many advertisers moved to digital platforms like CTV and OTT. Despite this, TV advertising remains relevant for broad reach. Food and beverages led ad volumes. Overall TV ad revenue is projected to fall before growing again.

items.title: IDBI Bank's renaming on radar ahead of divestment

This lack of clarity could impact the bidding process, though progress is expected.

Surpassing China, India has now emerged as Carlsberg's key market for future growth.

items.title: WEF 2026: Navigating global tech and trade disruptions, India stands strong, say CEOs at Davos
items.summary: Indian corporate leaders at Davos highlighted India's economic resilience amidst global challenges, emphasizing the need for faster reforms and deeper manufacturing to sustain momentum. They noted opportunities arising from global trade disruptions and the importance of a strong domestic market, while also stressing the need to boost the MSME sector and accelerate AI development.

items.title: Centre delicenses lower 6 GHz band for faster Wi-Fi at homes
items.summary: India has opened up the lower 6 GHz spectrum band for Wi-Fi. This move allows for significantly faster internet speeds on home networks. New technologies like Wi-Fi 7 can now operate in the country. This decision aligns India with global standards and signals its commitment to advanced wireless technology leadership.

Utilities will adopt AI and smart grid tech, with a goal for indigenously developed SCADA systems by 2030.
